eu.trentorise.smartcampus.osm.android.bonuspack.routing

Class Road

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.trentorise.smartcampus.osm.android.bonuspack.routing.Road

  • public class Road
extends java.lang.Object
    describes the way to go from a position to an other. Normally returned by a call to a Directions API (from MapQuest, GoogleMaps or other)
    Author:
    M.Kergall
    See Also:
    MapQuestRoadManager, GoogleRoadManager, OSRMRoadManager

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static CREATOR 
      BoundingBoxE6 mBoundingBox
      road bounding box
      double mDuration
      duration of the whole trip in sec.
      java.util.ArrayList<RoadLeg> mLegs
      there is one leg between each waypoint
      double mLength
      length of the whole route in km.
      java.util.ArrayList<RoadNode> mNodes 
      java.util.ArrayList<GeoPoint> mRouteHigh
      full shape: polyline, as an array of GeoPoints
      int mStatus 
      static int STATUS_DEFAULT
      STATUS_DEFAULT = any issue (technical issue, or no possible route) led to build a default road
      static int STATUS_INVALID
      STATUS_INVALID = road not built
      static int STATUS_OK
      STATUS_OK = road properly retrieved and built

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Road() 
      Road(java.util.ArrayList<GeoPoint> waypoints)
      default constructor when normal loading failed: the road shape only contains the waypoints; All distances and times are at 0; there is no node; mStatus equals DEFAULT.

                                     double duration)
        Parameters:
        length - in km
        duration - in sec
        Returns:
        a human-readable length&duration text.

      • getLengthDurationText

        public java.lang.String getLengthDurationText(int leg)
        Parameters:
        leg - leg index, starting from 0. -1 for the whole road
        Returns:
        length and duration of the whole road, or of a leg of the road, as a String, in a readable format.

      • buildLegs

        public void buildLegs(java.util.ArrayList<GeoPoint> waypoints)
        As MapQuest and OSRM doesn't provide legs information, we have to rebuild it, using the waypoints and the road nodes.
        Note that MapQuest legs fit well with waypoints, as there is a "dedicated" node for each waypoint. But OSRM legs are not precise, as there is no node "dedicated" to waypoints.

      • describeContents

        public int describeContents()

                 int flags)
